name: pattern
description:
A binary pattern that describes the standard octant layout:

```text
   3____7
 2/___6/|
 | 1__|_5
 0/___4/
```

This common layout is crucial for positional assumptions.

name: edges
description: Describes all possible octant corner connections.

description: A 3D box.

name: Octree
description: An octree that subdivides space for fast spatial searches.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new octree.

params.name: min
params.description: The lower bounds of the tree. If not provided, the octree will not create a root node.

params.name: max
params.description: The upper bounds of the tree. If not provided, the octree will not create a root node.

name: root
description: The root octant.

name: min
description: The lower bounds of the root octant.

name: max
description: The upper bounds of the root octant.

name: children
description: The children of the root octant.

name: getCenter
description: Calculates the center of this octree.

params.name: target
params.description: A target vector. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

return.description: A vector that describes the center of this octree.

name: getDimensions
description: Calculates the size of this octree.

params.name: target
params.description: A target vector. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

return.description: A vector that describes the size of this octree.

name: getDepth
description: Calculates the current depth of this octree.

return.description: The depth.

name: cull
description: Recursively collects octants that intersect with the specified region.

return.description: The octants.

name: findOctantsByLevel
description: Fetches all octants with the specified depth level.

return.description: The octants.

name: raycast
description:
Finds the octants that intersect with the given ray. The intersecting
octants are sorted by distance, closest first.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An optional target list to be filled with the intersecting octants.

return.description: The intersecting octants.

name: leaves
description:
Returns an iterator that traverses the octree and returns leaf nodes.

When a cull region is provided, the iterator will only return leaves that
intersect with that region.

return.description: An iterator.

name: [Symbol.iterator]
description: Returns an iterator that traverses the octree and returns all leaf nodes.

return.description: An iterator.

name: src/core/OctreeRaycaster.js
v
description: A list of vectors.

name: b
description: A box.

name: r
description: A ray.

name: octantTable
description:
A lookup-table containing octant ids. Used to determine the exit plane from
an octant.

name: flags
description: A byte that stores raycasting flags.

name: findEntryOctant
description:
Finds the entry plane of the first octant that a ray travels through.

Determining the first octant requires knowing which of the t0s is the
largest. The tms of the other axes must also be compared against that
largest t0.

return.description: The index of the first octant that the ray travels through.

name: findNextOctant
description:
Finds the next octant that intersects with the ray based on the exit plane of
the current one.

params.name: currentOctant
params.description: The index of the current octant.

return.description: The index of the next octant that the ray travels through.

name: raycastOctant
description: Finds all octants that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: tx0
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tx0 = (minX - rayOriginX) / rayDirectionX.

params.name: ty0
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial ty0 = (minY - rayOriginY) / rayDirectionY.

params.name: tz0
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tz0 = (minZ - rayOriginZ) / rayDirectionZ.

params.name: tx1
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tx1 = (maxX - rayOriginX) / rayDirectionX.

params.name: ty1
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial ty1 = (maxY - rayOriginY) / rayDirectionY.

params.name: tz1
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tz1 = (maxZ - rayOriginZ) / rayDirectionZ.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An array to be filled with the intersecting octants.

name: OctreeRaycaster
description:
An octree raycaster.

Based on:
 "An Efficient Parametric Algorithm for Octree Traversal"
 by J. Revelles et al. (2000).

name: intersectOctree
description:
Finds the octants that intersect with the given ray. The intersecting
octants are sorted by distance, closest first.

params.name: intersects
params.description: A list to be filled with intersecting octants.

p
description: A point.

name: PointOctant
description: An octant that maintains points.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new point octant.

name: points
description: The points.

name: data
description: Point data.

name: distanceToSquared
description: Computes the distance squared from this octant to the given point.

return.description: The distance squared.

name: distanceToCenterSquared
description:
Computes the distance squared from the center of this octant to the given
point.

return.description: The distance squared.

name: contains
description:
Checks if the given point lies inside this octant's boundaries.

This method can also be used to check if this octant intersects a sphere by
providing a radius as bias.

params.name: bias
params.description: A padding that extends the boundaries temporarily.

return.description: Whether the given point lies inside this octant.

name: redistribute
description: Redistributes existing points to child octants.

name: merge
description:
Gathers all points from the children. The children are expected to be leaf
octants and will be dropped afterwards.

name: src/points/PointOctree.js
THRESHOLD
description: A threshold for distance comparisons.

name: countPoints
description: Recursively counts how many points are in the given octant.

return.description: The amount of points.

name: put
description: Recursively places a point into the octree.

params.name: data
params.description: An object that the point represents.

return.description: Whether the operation was successful.

name: remove
description: Recursively finds a point in the octree and removes it.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent of the current octant.

return.description: The data entry of the removed point or null if it didn't exist.

name: fetch
description: Recursively finds a point in the octree and fetches the associated data.

return.description: The data entry that is associated with the given point or null if it doesn't exist.

name: move
description: Recursively moves an existing point to a new position.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent of the current octant.

return.description: The data entry of the updated point or null if it didn't exist.

name: findNearestPoint
description: Recursively finds the closest point to the given one.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

return.description: An object representing the nearest point or null if there is none. The object has a point and a data property.

name: findPoints
description:
Recursively finds points that are inside the specified radius around a given
position.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

params.name: result
params.description: An array to be filled with objects, each containing a point and a data property.

name: PointOctree
description: An octree that manages points.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new point octree.

params.name: min
params.description: The lower bounds of the tree.

params.name: max
params.description: The upper bounds of the tree.

params.name: maxPoints
params.description: Number of distinct points per octant before it splits up.

params.name: maxDepth
params.description: The maximum tree depth level, starting at 0.

name: root
description: The root octant.

name: bias
description:
An octant boundary bias.

The octree is considered "loose" with a bias greater than 0.

name: maxPoints
description:
Number of points per octant before a split occurs.

This value works together with the maximum depth as a secondary limiting
factor. Smaller values cause splits to occur earlier which results in a
faster and deeper tree growth.

name: maxDepth
description:
The maximum tree depth level.

It's possible to use Infinity, but keep in mind that allowing infinitely
small octants can have a severely negative impact on performance.
Finding a value that works best for a specific scene is advisable.

name: pointCount
description: The amount of points that are currently in this octree.

name: countPoints
description: Counts how many points are in the given octant.

return.description: The amount of points.

name: put
description: Puts a point into the octree.

params.name: point
params.description: A point. If it's already in the octree, the data entry will be updated.

params.name: data
params.description: A data object that belongs to the point.

return.description: Whether the operation was successful.

name: remove
description: Removes a point from the tree.

return.description: The data entry of the removed point or null if it didn't exist.

name: fetch
description: Retrieves the data of the specified point.

return.description: The data entry that is associated with the given point or null if it doesn't exist.

name: move
description:
Moves an existing point to a new position. Has no effect if the point
doesn't exist.

return.description: The data entry of the updated point or null if it didn't exist.

name: findNearestPoint
description: Finds the closest point to the given one.

params.name: maxDistance
params.description: An upper limit for the distance between the points.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

return.description: An object representing the nearest point or null if there is none. The object has a point and a data property.

name: findPoints
description: Finds points that are in the specified radius around the given position.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

return.description: An array of objects, each containing a point and a data property.

name: raycast
description: Finds the points that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An array to be filled with the intersecting points.

return.description: The intersecting points.

name: testPoints
description: Collects points that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: octants
params.description: An array containing octants that intersect with the ray.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An array to be filled with intersecting points.

RayPointIntersection
description: A collection of ray-point intersection data.

name: constructor
description: Constructs new ray-point intersection data.

params.name: distance
params.description: The distance from the origin of the ray to the point.

params.name: distanceToRay
params.description: The distance from the point to the ray.

name: distance
description: The distance from the origin of the ray to the point.

name: distanceToRay
description: The shortest distance from the point to the ray.

name: point
description: The point.

name: object
description: The point's data.

content:
# Sparse Octree

[![Build status](https://travis-ci.org/vanruesc/sparse-octree.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/vanruesc/sparse-octree) 
[![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/sparse-octree.svg)](http://badge.fury.io/js/sparse-octree) 
[![Dependencies](https://david-dm.org/vanruesc/sparse-octree.svg?branch=master)](https://david-dm.org/vanruesc/sparse-octree)

A sparse octree data structure.

*[Extensive Demo](https://vanruesc.github.io/sparse-octree/public/demo) ∴
[API Reference](https://vanruesc.github.io/sparse-octree/public/docs)*


## Installation

This library requires the peer dependencies [iterator-result](https://github.com/vanruesc/iterator-result) and [math-ds](https://github.com/vanruesc/math-ds).

```sh
npm install iterator-result math-ds sparse-octree
``` 


## Usage

##### Custom Octrees

```javascript
import { Octree, CubicOctant } from "sparse-octree";

export class CubicOctree extends Octree {

	constructor(min, size) {

		this.root = new CubicOctant(min, size);

	}

}
```

##### Points

```javascript
import { Vector3 } from "math-ds";
import { PointOctree } from "sparse-octree";

const min = new Vector3(-1, -1, -1);
const max = new Vector3(1, 1, 1);

const octree = new PointOctree(min, max);
const myData = {};

octree.put(new Vector3(0, 0, 0), myData);
octree.fetch(new Vector3(0, 0, 0)); // => myData
```

A full point octree example can be found [here](https://jsfiddle.net/6gt9fjmq/10/).


## Features

- Base Functionality
	- Pointer-based structure
  - Handles octant splitting
  - Adheres to a [common octant layout](http://vanruesc.github.io/sparse-octree/public/docs/variable/index.html#static-variable-pattern)
  - Supports raycasting
  - Supports culling
  - Supports cubic octrees
  - Can be extended to manage any data
- Provides a point management implementation


## Octree Helper

The [octree-helper](https://github.com/vanruesc/octree-helper) module provides
an octree visualisation tool for [three.js](https://threejs.org/).


## Contributing

Maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
	"name": "sparse-octree",
	"version": "5.0.1",
	"description": "A sparse octree data structure.",
	"homepage": "https://github.com/vanruesc/sparse-octree",
	"main": "build/sparse-octree.js",
	"module": "src/index.js",
	"sideEffects": false,
	"license": "Zlib",

	"keywords": [
		"partition",
		"hierarchy",
		"subdivision",
		"raycasting",
		"3d",
		"spatial",
		"voxel",
		"points",
		"frustum",
		"culling"
	],

	"author": {
		"name": "Raoul van Rschen",
		"email": "vanruesc@outlook.de"
	},

	"repository": {
		"type": "git",
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/sparse-octree.git"
	},

	"bugs": {
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/sparse-octree/issues"
	},

	"files": [
		"src",
		"build"
	],

	"scripts": {
		"lint": "npm run lint:lib && npm run lint:demo && npm run lint:test",
		"lint:config": "eslint *.js",
		"lint:lib": "eslint src",
		"lint:demo": "eslint demo/src",
		"lint:test": "eslint test",
		"build": "rollup -c",
		"build:production": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production rollup -c",
		"doc": "esdoc",
		"deploy": "cpx demo/assets/** public/demo",
		"test": "ava",
		"prepack": "npm run lint && npm run build:production"
	},

	"engines": {
		"node": ">=4.0.0",
		"npm": ">=4.0.0"
	},

	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "delta"
	},

	"peerDependencies": {
		"iterator-result": "0.x.x",
		"math-ds": "1.x.x"
	},

	"devDependencies": {
		"ava": "0.x.x",
		"babel-core": "6.x.x",
		"babel-plugin-external-helpers": "6.x.x",
		"babel-preset-env": "1.x.x",
		"cpx": "1.x.x",
		"cross-env": "5.x.x",
		"delta-controls": "2.x.x",
		"esdoc": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"eslint": "5.x.x",
		"eslint-config-delta": "0.x.x",
		"iterator-result": "0.x.x",
		"math-ds": "1.x.x",
		"octree-helper": "0.x.x",
		"rollup": "0.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel": "3.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel-minify": "5.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "3.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-string": "2.x.x",
		"synthetic-event": "0.x.x",
		"three": "0.94.x",
		"three-demo": "2.x.x"
	}
}
